0.cdata!: Haute-Volta - Projet de Developpement de L'elevage

abstracts.cdata!:
The Livestock Development Project for
            Upper Volta will be a broadly based program to assist cattle
            production in Dedougou and Bobo-Dioulasso Organisme Regional
            de Developpement's (ORD) through ranch development, and
            the improvement of livestock marketing, meat processing and
            veterinary services. It will help about 300,000 traditional
            cattle producers and, in addition, will introduce commercial
            ranching to the traditional sector. The project, carried out
            over five years, 1976-80, would comprise: (a) establishing
            nine group ranches and a group ranch development center; (b)
            providing improved veterinary services throughout Dedougou
            and Bobo-Dioulasso ORD regions; (c) constructing a livestock
            market and holding ground at Bobo-Dioulasso as well as
            improving 730 km of stock routes; (d) renovating a
            slaughterhouse at Bobo-Dioulasso; and (e) providing for
            training, field trials, project evaluation and monitoring,
            and future project preparation.
